title: Dakota Fanning to Star in Apple TV Thriller as Undercover Treasury Agent
description: Dakota Fanning will star as an undercover agent of the U.S. Department of the Treasury in a new Apple TV series created by Emmy-winning â€œHomelandâ€ p
body:
Dakota Fanning will star as an undercover agent of the U.S. Department of the Treasury in a new Apple TV series created by Emmy-winning â€œHomelandâ€ producer Alex Cary.

	The yet-to-be-titled thriller follows Fanning as a mole operating within a multi-billion dollar international conglomerate with powerful political and criminal tentacles. Per the logline, she â€œbecomes conflicted between her mission and a belief that her principal target, the heir apparent to all that corrupt power, is at his core a good man and worthy of her love.â€
	

	The show is part of Caryâ€™s overall deal with Sony Pictures TV, which serves as the studio on the series. He executive produces via his FLW Productions banner. Julie Gardner (â€œLady in the Lake,â€ â€œDoctor Whoâ€) executive produces for Bad Wolf America, and Fanning executive produces alongside Elle Fanning and Brittany Kahan Ward for Lewellen PicturesÂ (â€œMargoâ€™s Got Money Troubles,â€ â€œThe Greatâ€). Kari Skogland (â€œSmoke,â€ â€œThe Handmaidâ€™s Taleâ€) will direct and serve as executive producer.


	Deadline broke the news.

schema.headline: Dakota Fanning to Star in Apple TV Thriller as Undercover Treasury Agent

title: L.A. Production Shows No Sign of a Rebound Yet
description: Los Angeles production showed no sign of a rebound in the fourth quarter of 2025, as the industry is still waiting for a hike in state incentives to
body:
Los Angeles production showed no sign of a rebound in the fourth quarter of 2025, as the industry is still waiting for a hike in state incentives to have an effect.

	Production days for film, TV and commercials fell 12.3% compared to the prior quarter, according to data from FilmLA. That continues a downward trend that has persisted since 2022. The total shoot days across those categories has not increased for two quarters in a row since 2021.
	

	For 2025 overall, production volume was about half what it was in 2019.


	California Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a major expansion of the stateâ€™s film and TV production incentive in July. The California Film Commission has since allocated $771 million in tax incentives to dozens of film and TV projects, including â€œJumanji,â€ â€œHeat 2,â€ and â€œBaywatchâ€ â€” but any impact from that expenditure has yet to show up in the production figures. Approved projects have 180 days to begin filming from the issuance of a credit.

	Philip Sokoloski, a spokesman for FilmLA, said the latest figures are â€œdisappointingâ€ but not surprising.

	â€œFilmLA has consistently projected that the full effect of the expanded Film and Television Tax Credit Program would take time to materialize, and although our overall numbers remain low, there are dozens of incentivized projects that have yet to begin filming,â€ he said in a statement.

	According to FilmLA, 17.3% of film projects that shot on location last quarter were subsidized by the state. That was down from 19.2% in the same quarter of 2024, but up from 2023 â€” during the actorsâ€™ strike â€” when 8.7% received state subsidies.
	

	The rise of state incentives is more striking in TV, where the share of subsidized projects grew from 1.5% in Q4 of 2023 to 6.5% in Q4 of 2024. That figure rose to 11.1% in the same quarter of 2025. Among TV comedies, 31.8% of the shoot days were tied to subsidized projects, while 31% of TV drama production was state-backed. The state has traditionally backed only scripted shows, but recently added â€œlarge-scaleâ€ reality shows to the mix.

	But the increasing state support comes amid a dramatic overall decline. TV production days came in 50% below their five-year average in the fourth quarter, and 22% down from the same quarter in 2024. Film production was 31.7% below the five-year average and 19.7% down from Q4 of 2024.

	TV comedies were relatively flat compared to the same quarter in the prior year â€” down only 6% â€” but were 66% below the five-year average. TV dramas fell 36.4% in Q4 of 2025 compared to Q4 of 2024 â€” and came in 43.3% below the five-year average.

schema.headline: L.A. Production Shows No Sign of a Rebound Yet

title: â€˜Baywatchâ€™ Reboot Sets Open Casting Call; Performers Encouraged to Dress â€˜Baywatch Readyâ€™ but â€˜Avoid Overly Revealing Stylesâ€™
description:
Foxâ€˜s upcoming â€œBaywatchâ€ reboot is headed to the beach to find its new cast.

	The network and Fremantle have set an open casting call in Los Angel
body:
Foxâ€˜s upcoming â€œBaywatchâ€ reboot is headed to the beach to find its new cast.

	The network and Fremantle have set an open casting call in Los Angeles on Feb. 18 to populate the series with both actors and non-actors. Adults of all ethnicities and genders are welcome to audition, and will be considered for series regular roles, recurring characters and walk-ons. According to Fox, available roles include everything â€œfrom lifeguards and beachgoers to bartenders, buddies and love interests to rescuers and rescuees of all kinds, as well as additional characters yet to be written.â€
	

	The casting call emphasizes that performers should arrive â€œBaywatchâ€-ready, defining that as â€œwardrobe that evokes a beach setting,â€ while noting that they should also remain â€œpolished, professional and avoid overly revealing styles and costumes.â€ The humorous addendum seems like a reference to the high-cut red swimsuits the original â€œBaywatchâ€ was famous for â€” but whether Fox is planning for more modest lifeguard costumes this time around or just hoping to prevent wardrobe malfunctions in the audition room remains to be seen. 


	The casting call will be held at the Marina Del Rey Marriott. Registration is open at baywatchcastingcall.com.

	â€œBaywatchâ€ will begin production in March on Venice Beach and the Fox lot. The series is set to premiere during the 2027-2027 season. Matt Nix serves as showrunner and executive produces alongside Michael Berk, Greg Bonann, Dante Di Loreto, Doug Schwartz and Mike Horowitz.

	The original â€œBaywatchâ€ was at one point the most-watched series in the worlds, airing in more than 200 countries and reaching more than a billion viewers per week according to some estimates. Starring David Hasselhoff, it ran for 11 seasons from 1989 to 2001, first on NBC and later in syndication with a 2003 reunion film airing on Fox.
	

	â€œTheÂ â€˜Baywatchâ€™Â Open Casting CallÂ gives actors a rare opportunity to join the team of an iconic global sensation that celebrates the California spirit and helped define L.A.â€™s incomparable beach culture,â€ said Fox Television Network president Michael Thorn in a statement. â€œWeâ€™re excited to discover fresh faces with authentic SoCal energy as we bring backÂ BaywatchÂ for a new generation of fans.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Baywatchâ€™ Reboot Sets Open Casting Call; Performers Encouraged to Dress â€˜Baywatch Readyâ€™ but â€˜Avoid Overly Revealing Stylesâ€™

title: Johnny Knoxville Teases â€˜Jackass 5â€™ Stunts After Traumatic Brain Injury: â€˜I Canâ€™t Get Hit in the Head Anymoreâ€™ but â€˜I Donâ€™t Care About Anything Elseâ€™
description: When Johnny Knoxville announced a new â€œJackassâ€ movie coming to theaters in June, fans of the slapstick stunt franchise wondered what type of role t
body:
When Johnny Knoxville announced a new â€œJackassâ€ movie coming to theaters in June, fans of the slapstick stunt franchise wondered what type of role the 54-year-old ringleader would have in the production. 

	In 2022â€™s â€œJackass Forever,â€ Knoxville performed a stunt where he was pummeled by a bull. He flipped in the air and landed on his head, causing a brain hemorrhage, concussion, broken wrist and broken rib. He has talked about how the injury changed his outlook on the future, indicating he would retire from doing dangerous stunts. Plus, the fourth â€œJackassâ€ movie introduced a bevy of younger performers alongside the original crew, hinting at the franchiseâ€™s potential future.
	

	In a brief discussion about â€œJackass 5â€ on the â€œBooks That Changed My Lifeâ€ podcast, Knoxville was asked, â€œAre you allowed to do stunts anymore?â€


	â€œI canâ€™t do anything where I can get another concussion,â€ Knoxville said. â€œ[Iâ€™m] way over my limit for concussions, but I donâ€™t care about anything else. I just canâ€™t get hit in the head anymore â€” but a lot of other guys can.â€

	Knoxville said the â€œJackassâ€ movies are â€œpure hell for the cast, but theyâ€™re a lot of fun for me,â€ adding, â€œTheyâ€™re having fun too. Iâ€™m very excited about that.â€

	â€œJackass 5â€ will premiere in theaters on June 26 from Paramount Pictures. Little is known about the project except for that it will include new material and never-before-seen archival footage. Variety reported that original cast member Bam Margera has signed a deal to appear in old footage, ending a years-long feud between him and the â€œJackassâ€ team following his firing from the fourth movie. Margera is not expected to film new stunts.

schema.headline: Johnny Knoxville Teases â€˜Jackass 5â€™ Stunts After Traumatic Brain Injury: â€˜I Canâ€™t Get Hit in the Head Anymoreâ€™ but â€˜I Donâ€™t Care About Anything Elseâ€™

title: DDA Hires Matt AndrÃ©e Wiltens, Ryan Smith for Key Roles in Los Angeles
description:
DDA, a global content PR corporate communications firm, has made two key hires in Los Angeles.

	Matt AndrÃ©e Wiltens (above, right) joins the compan
body:
DDA, a global content PR corporate communications firm, has made two key hires in Los Angeles.

	Matt AndrÃ©e Wiltens (above, right) joins the company from talent agency Gersh, in the role of senior vice president of U.S. Entertainment and Strategy. Ryan Smith (left) has been named director of domestic film and series accounts.

	â€œMatt brings a rare combination of creative vision, operational expertise, and extensive industry connections, establishing him as a trusted advisor to some of the industryâ€™s highest profile executives and creatives,â€ said DDA partner Dana Archer on behalf of her board.Â â€œRyan is a highly respected and connected film and television publicist, whose leadership and passion for storytelling will shine at DDA. Both are accomplished professionals with a passion for movies, who will integrate seamlessly into our company culture as we continue our expansion in the US.â€
	

	AndrÃ©e Wiltens has a deep film resume spanning decades in-house at studios, production companies, and agencies across communications, film PR, awards, brand building and marketing. At Gersh, he worked as head of global corporate communications and will bring the agency over to DDA as a client. Prior to Gersh, he worked for Amblin Partners as VP of Marketing and Communications, leading award-winning campaigns for â€œ1917,â€ â€œThe Fabelmans,â€ â€œGreen Bookâ€ and â€œWest Side Story,â€ collaborating closely with Steven Spielberg, Sam Mendes, and leading distributors. He began his career at Paramount, where he spent ten years working across PR and marketing â€“ both international as well as global brand strategy.
	

	Smith spent close to a decade running point and working on campaigns at R&C and PMK, across Apple TV, Lionsgate, Amazon Prime Video, Hulu, Angel Studios, AGBO, CJ 4DPLEX and more, as well as supporting talent publicity and executive visibility campaigns. Smith will lead the U.S. film and series team in Los Angeles and work directly as a counterpart to Katie Conklin and team in NYC.

schema.headline: DDA Hires Matt AndrÃ©e Wiltens, Ryan Smith for Key Roles in Los Angeles

title: TimothÃ©e Chalamet Says a â€˜Marty Supremeâ€™ Background Actor Threatened Him on Set: â€˜You Donâ€™t Want to Fâ€” With Me. You Donâ€™t Want to See Me Angryâ€™
description: TimothÃ©e Chalamet revealed during a recent Q&A with Robert Downey Jr. at New Yorkâ€™s DGA Theater that he was threatened by a background actor while f
body:
TimothÃ©e Chalamet revealed during a recent Q&A with Robert Downey Jr. at New Yorkâ€™s DGA Theater that he was threatened by a background actor while filming a scene for Josh Safdieâ€™s â€œMarty Supreme.â€ 

	â€œI wonâ€™t say who, but in that motel sequence, there are a lot of non-actorsâ€¦that I find it really thrilling to work with, but sometimes it would take multiple takes to really get something out of them,â€ Chalamet said (per People). â€œAnd Iâ€™m really getting in the guyâ€™s face and Iâ€™m really trying to get him angry with me. I was saying to Josh, â€˜Heâ€™s not getting angry with me, heâ€™s not getting angry with me.'â€ 
	

	Although the Oscar-nominated actor assumed he wasnâ€™t getting a rise out of the unnamed extra, he was mistaken.


	â€œI did another take, and then the guy said, â€˜I was just in jail for 30 years. You really donâ€™t want to fuck with me. You donâ€™t want to see me angry,'â€ Chalamet said with a nervous laugh. â€œI said to Josh, â€˜Holy shit, who do you have me opposite, man?â€™â€

	Chalamet stars in Safdieâ€™s sports dramedy as Marty Mauser, who chases his dream of becoming a table-tennis champion. â€œMarty Supremeâ€ is a fictionalized account of the real-life Marty Reisman, who won five world championship medals in table tennis. 

	Chalamet is an Oscar frontrunner for his performance in â€œMarty Supreme,â€ which has already scored him honors from the Criticsâ€™ Choice Awards and Golden Globes. He has also received an Actor Award nomination from SAG. 

	In his acceptance speech at the Golden Globes, Chalamet said, â€œMy dad instilled in me a spirit of gratitude growing up. â€˜Always be grateful for what you have.â€™ Itâ€™s allowed me to leave the ceremony in the past empty handed with my head held high, grateful just to be here. But Iâ€™d be lying if I said those moments didnâ€™t make this moment that much sweeter.â€

schema.headline: TimothÃ©e Chalamet Says a â€˜Marty Supremeâ€™ Background Actor Threatened Him on Set: â€˜You Donâ€™t Want to Fâ€” With Me. You Donâ€™t Want to See Me Angryâ€™

title: â€˜The Housemaidâ€™ Hits $200 Million Globally as Sydney Sweeney Preps Sequel
description:
â€œThe Housemaidâ€ has cleared a notable box office milestone, surpassing $200 million in global ticket sales. 

	The R-rated film, starring Sydney Swe
body:
â€œThe Housemaidâ€ has cleared a notable box office milestone, surpassing $200 million in global ticket sales. 

	The R-rated film, starring Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried, has generated $100 million domestically and $100 million internationally after four weekends of release. Those ticket sales are especially promising considering that Lionsgate spent just $35 million to produce the film.


	â€œThe Housemaidâ€ opened on Dec. 19 with a modest $19 million in North America. Thanks to great word-of-mouth, the psychological thriller is expected to end its theatrical run with $225 million to $275 million worldwide, a huge result at a trying time for mid-budget films. In a twist, the overseas tally has already surpassed the domestic haul, with top territories including the U.K. (where â€œThe Housemaidâ€ was No. 1 last weekend ahead of â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ and â€œZootopiaâ€) with $23.7 million, France with $17.5 million and Australia with $5.6 million.
	

	â€œâ€˜The Housemaidâ€™ demonstrates what can be accomplished when the right stars â€” Sydney Sweeney, Amanda Seyfried, Brandon Sklenar, Michele Morrone, and Elizabeth Perkins â€” are matched with brilliant filmmakers and captivating material, with it all coming together to create a truly compelling moviegoing experience and an undeniable appetite for more,â€ Lionsgate Motion Picture Group Adam Fogelson said in a statement. â€œPaul Feig surpassed expectations by delivering a thriller thatâ€™s everything audiences have been asking for. Early on, our team â€” particularly the women at Lionsgate â€” recognized Freida McFaddenâ€™s trilogy as exceptional cinematic material before it became a literary phenomenon. Congratulations to our outstanding cast and filmmakers and the entire Lionsgate team.â€
	

	â€œThe Housemaidâ€ is Lionsgateâ€™s second consecutive wide release to cross the $200 million mark worldwide after Novemberâ€™s â€œNow You See Me: Now You Donâ€™tâ€ ($241 million). The studio had an otherwise quiet year in 2025 with misses like the â€œJohn Wickâ€ spinoff â€œBallerinaâ€ ($137 million against a $90 million budget) and the Aziz Ansari comedy â€œGood Fortuneâ€ ($26 million against a $30 million budget).

	Directed by Feig (â€œBridesmaidsâ€) and adapted from the best-selling novel by Freida McFadden, â€œThe Housemaidâ€ follows a young woman (Sweeney) with a troubled past who becomes the live-in maid for an ultra-wealthy family (Seyfried and Sklenar play the not-so-picture perfect husband and wife) that isnâ€™t what it seems. Varietyâ€™sÂ Owen Gleiberman praised the campy nature ofÂ â€œThe Housemaid,â€ saying the movie â€œgoes right over-the-top, but it does so in a way thatâ€™s unusually clever and knowing.â€

	â€œThe Housemaidâ€ is the first novel in McFaddenâ€™s best-selling trilogy, so naturally the sequel, â€œThe Housemaidâ€™s Secret,â€ is already in the works with Sweeney and Feig.

schema.headline: â€˜The Housemaidâ€™ Hits $200 Million Globally as Sydney Sweeney Preps Sequel

title: Disney+ Boards Will Forteâ€™s â€˜The Last Man on Earthâ€™ Remake With Artus, the French Star of â€˜A Little Something Extraâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Disney+ has boarded â€œThe Last Man on Earth,â€ a French remake of Will Forteâ€˜s hit 2015 sci-fi comedy series which will be headlined by French star Ar
body:
Disney+ has boarded â€œThe Last Man on Earth,â€ a French remake of Will Forteâ€˜s hit 2015 sci-fi comedy series which will be headlined by French star Artus. 

	An original series created by Forte, a â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ household name, â€œThe Last Man on Earthâ€ is produced by 20th Century Studios and will premiere this year on Disney+. The show was unveiled at the Disney+ showcase in Paris on Thursday evening. 


	In the remake, a catastrophe has led to the extinction of the human race. â€œAfter traveling across the country, Adam must face the facts: he is the last man on Earth. Free from everything, he enjoys the advantages of solitudeâ€¦ but remains desperately alone. However, he still holds out hope that another survivor exists. And perhaps even a female survivor,â€ reads the synopsis. 
	

	The original series, also called â€œThe Last Man on Earth,â€ aired on Fox from 2015 and 2018, and earned five Primetime Emmy Awards nominations. Forte played the lead role in the show and starred opposite Kristen Schaal and January Jones, alongside Jason SudeikisÂ and Kristen Wiig.

	Artus is a well-known French standup comedian who made his feature directorial debut with â€œA Little Something Extraâ€ which topped the French box office in 2024, grossing over $74 million in France. The modestly budgeted comedy had an ensemble cast of young non-professionals with different types of disabilities.

	Disney+ didnâ€™t unveil many further details about the new show but it will likely have an international backdrop and cast. The streamer announced a flurry of other series and features at the Paris showcase.

schema.headline: Disney+ Boards Will Forteâ€™s â€˜The Last Man on Earthâ€™ Remake With Artus, the French Star of â€˜A Little Something Extraâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Jack Oâ€™Connell on Going From â€˜Sinnersâ€™ to â€™28 Years Later: The Bone Templeâ€™ and His â€˜Amazing Yearâ€™ of Villains: â€˜It Was Nothing but Sheer Luckâ€™
description: Less than a year after he jigged terrifyingly into Ryan Cooglerâ€™s supernatural horror â€œSinnersâ€ as an Irish-dancing vampire, Jack Oâ€™Connell is back
body:
Less than a year after he jigged terrifyingly into Ryan Cooglerâ€™s supernatural horror â€œSinnersâ€ as an Irish-dancing vampire, Jack Oâ€™Connell is back with an even more bonkers baddie.

	Sir Jimmy Crystal â€”Â who the actor admits is the â€œmaddest characterâ€ heâ€™s ever seen â€”Â may have been first introduced at the very end of Danny Boyleâ€™s zombie sequel â€œ28 Years Later.â€ But that was just a taste of the lunacy to come. In Nia DaCostaâ€™s riotous and bloody sequel to the sequel â€œ28 Years Later: The Bone Templeâ€ (also written by Alex Garland and out Jan. 16), he truly comes into his own as the devil-worshipping, pseudo evangelical cult â€œlordâ€ of a gang of sadistic murderers called the Jimmies. Clad in a rich purple tracksuit and with an luxuriant head of hair, Crystal is an exceptional role and one Oâ€™Connell says he rejoiced in making his own. 
	

	From Sony Pictures, â€œThe Bone Templeâ€ is also the latest major project for the Brit, currently in the midst of a prolonged purple patch on the big screen, with more significant titles coming up (including a stomp into the MonsterVerse). While he says heâ€™s not getting â€œanalytical nowâ€ about his cinematic reignition, which was arguably sparked by â€œBack to Blackâ€ in 2024, he admits heâ€™s enjoying â€œsavouringâ€ the reception his performances have been getting. 

	
		Sir Jimmy must have been a delicious character to to sink your teeth into	

	Yeah, it was. It was wild, wild fun. But unbounded. So in a lot of ways, itâ€™s very freeing.
	
		What was the description of Jimmy when you were first told about him?	

	I just remember, above all of his dialog, it said â€˜Sir Jimmy Crystal,â€™ which in itself is easily the maddest character I think Iâ€™ve ever seen. 
	
	
		Iâ€™m assuming they came straight to you and there wasnâ€™t an audition process. 	

	There was a bit of a procedure, where it involved going around to Dannyâ€™s house. Nia was there too. And as a Danny Boyle fan being invited to his house was a monumental day for me. We sat down and chatted, and then I waited to hear back. 
	
		I understand you hadnâ€™t actually shot â€œSinnersâ€ at the time.	

	No, the invite to Dannyâ€™s house was prior to going to New Orleans to shoot â€œSinners.â€ But I knew it was going to happen, so when I had the meeting for this I thought, if it did go my way, it was going to amount to an amazing year.
	
		Sir Jimmy Crystal is introduced right at the end of â€œ28 Years Laterâ€ and itâ€™s a really wild tonal shift from the rest of the film. What reaction did you get from people who saw you in that? 	

	Yeah, largely it was WTF. Which is great. And thereâ€™s an ambiguity as well â€”Â donâ€™t know if these guys are to be liked or to be trusted. They seem to be a force for good at first and then pretty quickly, as this film opens, you kind of realize that was a misguided view. But itâ€™s great to get to toy with people like that â€”Â itâ€™s fun.



	

					Jack Oâ€™Connell alongside Ralph Fiennes in â€œ28 Years Later: The Bone Templeâ€
	


	
		Did I read somewhere that the delightful, almost regal-looking, purple tracksuit that you wear in the film was your decision?	

	Yeah! Purple was the colour of monarchs, wasnâ€™t it? So I just thought itâ€™d give him status. Heâ€™s quite pristine. And he has what he refers to as his â€œfingersâ€ doing all the dirty work. 
	
		As you said, this has been a great year for you with â€œSinnersâ€ and now this. Have you enjoyed entering your villain era?	

	Yeah, I guess so. But itâ€™s nothing but sheer luck that â€œSinnersâ€ came and was followed by â€œThe Bone Temple.â€ So I just have to count my lucky chickens.
	
		Youâ€™ve got a very different villain coming up as ex The Sun editor Larry Lamb in â€œInk,â€ back with Danny	

	Itâ€™s a great space to be in. Itâ€™s sort of biographical, but in a fascinating era in British culture. And yeah, itâ€™s Danny. It was a play, a phenomenally successful play. And with another top top writer. So again, sheer luck. 
	
		And youâ€™re entering another major studio franchise, this time the Monsterverse with â€œGodzilla x Kong: Supernova.â€ Is this another villain?	

	No, I think this guyâ€™s more of a straight shooter. Itâ€™s important to mix it up. But thatâ€™s shot, all done and dusted, and was a phenomenal experience. Big toys, big machines, big studios. Big!
	
	
		It sounds like itâ€™s a very good time to b Jack Oâ€™Connell at the moment and since â€œBack to Blackâ€ youâ€™ve been going from one big film project to the next. Do you feel like youâ€™re having a particularly excellent moment right now â€”Â and is there anything you can credit that to?	

	Personally, the view is always on whatâ€™s next. So when things get received well, that is brilliant. But hopefully Iâ€™m ways into a career that lasts for a little while longer yet. So I wouldnâ€™t be getting too analytical now. But listen, with that said, it feels great the reception to â€œSinnersâ€ and so far, â€œThe Bone Templeâ€ feels great. And itâ€™s worth savouring those moments. 
	
		At the BAFTA Rising Star nominations last year, which you presented, I think it was David Jonsson who said that youâ€™d been a huge inspiration to him as a young actor. But Iâ€™ve heard it from others too, particular actors not born into privilege or with industry connections to give them a leg up. Is that something youâ€™ve heard of, or something youâ€™ve even considered? 	

	Itâ€™s lovely to hear. Itâ€™s probably one of the most rewarding things you could expect to hear. So, yeah, it means a great deal to me. I can point to a handful of actors whose careers have meant the world to me. Particularly in an industry like this one, where it certainly does help to have familial ties, being the sort of outsider that other young actors can point to it and go, â€˜Yeah, thatâ€™s how itâ€™s done.â€™ Fantastic. Thatâ€™s half the reason I get out of bed in the morning.
	
		Finally, did you get the keep the purple tracksuit? 	

	Oh yeah, thatâ€™s back with me. 100%. In case we need it again.

schema.headline: Jack Oâ€™Connell on Going From â€˜Sinnersâ€™ to â€™28 Years Later: The Bone Templeâ€™ and His â€˜Amazing Yearâ€™ of Villains: â€˜It Was Nothing but Sheer Luckâ€™

title: â€˜Industryâ€™ Season 4 Premiere Viewership Jumps 20% From Season 3
description: â€œIndustryâ€ returned to HBO for its fourth season on Sunday night and reached more than 800,000 viewers in its first three days of availability, mark
body:
â€œIndustryâ€ returned to HBO for its fourth season on Sunday night and reached more than 800,000 viewers in its first three days of availability, marking a 20% increase from the drama seriesâ€™ Season 3 opener in 2024 and its best season premiere ever.

	That number was calculated from a combination of Nielsenâ€™s measurement of viewers on HBOâ€™s cable channel and Warner Bros. Discoveryâ€™s own data regarding streams on HBO Max, and refers to viewership in the U.S. only.
	

	WBD also reports that both in the U.S. and globally, catch-up viewing of â€œIndustryâ€ in the week leading up to the Season 4 premiere was 60% stronger this year than in the week before Season 3 premiered.


	Per the official logline, â€œIndustryâ€ is set â€œin the world of international finance, as seen through the eyes of ambitious twenty-somethings struggling to secure their futures. The series follows a group of young graduates competing for a limited set of permanent positions at a top investment bank in London â€“ but the boundaries between colleague, friend, lover and enemy soon blur as they immerse themselves in a company culture defined as much by sex, drugs, and ego as it is by deals and dividends. As members of the group rise and fall, they must decide whether life is about more than the bottom line.â€

	Season 4 follows Harper (Myhaâ€™la) and Yasmin (Marisa Abela) as they â€œare drawn into a high stakes, globetrotting cat-and-mouse game when a splashy fintech darling bursts onto the London scene. As Yasmin navigates her relationship with tech founder Sir Henry Muck (Kit Harington) and Harper is pulled into the orbit of enigmatic executive Whitney Halberstram (Max Minghella), their twisted friendship begins to warp and ignite under the pressure of money, power, and the desire to be on top.â€
	

	Mickey Down & Konrad Kay created â€œIndustryâ€ and executive produce alongside Jane Tranter, Kate Crowther and Ryan Rasmussen for Bad Wolf; Kathleen McCaffrey for Little Gems; and Rebecca Ferguson for BBC.

schema.headline: â€˜Industryâ€™ Season 4 Premiere Viewership Jumps 20% From Season 3

title: TMZ Streaming Live, Come Into Our Newsroom and Watch Things Happen!
description:
TMZ Live Stream
                          Come Into Our Office and Watch News Happen!!!
body:
TMZ Live Stream
                          Come Into Our Office and Watch News Happen!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 15, 2026
                            9:49 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          We want you to be a part of TMZ, so every weekday, between 9:30 AM and 11:30 AM PT, we take you inside our newsroom via live stream.
      
    
          You never know what you're gonna get ... a big story that breaks, an argument erupts in the room, or someone's just joking around.
      
    
          Your comments are a big part of the stream, and the staff spends a lot of time speaking directly to you. Every day is different!
      
    
          We also use our live stream to produce our "TMZ Live" TV show.

title: Cheek of the Week -- Tammy Hembrow!
description:
Cheek of the Week ğŸ‘ ...
                          Tammy Hembrow
                          Sizzle
body:
Cheek of the Week ğŸ‘ ...
                          Tammy Hembrow
                          Sizzles In Yellow!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 15, 2026
                            10:00 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  January 15, 2026
                                11:25 AM PST
                                    
      
    
      
        
              
    
    
          It's only January, but Tammy Hembrow has us saying, "YELLOW, summer ğŸ¤—!"
      
    
          The famous Australian fitness model took her curves to the 'gram, and it took us all of 15 seconds to crown her this week's Cheek of the Week!
      
    
          Can you guess the 5-letter word?! Here's your clue: Tammy Hembrow!
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Showin' off her backside on the beach, Tammy sported a yellow triangular top and a matching thong bottom ... Surf was totally up!!!
      
    
          Slip into the gallery and see for yourself!

title: Farrah Abraham's Premature Political Birth, 2 Years Early For Austin Mayor
description:
'Teen Mom' Farrah Abraham
                          Premature Political Birth
body:
'Teen Mom' Farrah Abraham
                          Premature Political Birth
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 15, 2026
                            11:29 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          "Teen Mom" Farrah Abraham wants to get into politics ... but she's having a premature political birth here ... because she's jumping into the race for mayor of Austin, Texas way too early.
      
    
          Farrah joined us on "TMZ Live" Thursday and we asked her about her recent social media announcement that she was running for mayor in the Texas capital ... and we kinda burst her bubble with some quick fact-checking, and her reaction is priceless.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Thing is ... Farrah says she's running for mayor in 2026, but we called up City Hall during our live interview ... the election isn't until 2028 -- that's over 2 freaking years from now!!!
      

          Farrah seems stunned and confused ... and she goes back and forth with us about the election cycle and the differences between local, district and federal offices ... it's TV gold you won't get on C-SPAN.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          For the record, Austin's mayor is Kirk Watson and he was elected in 2024, and he's got a 4-year term ... so do the math.
      
    
          Farrah's already rolled out a campaign website and is seeking political donations ... and she's being a good sport with the calendar mix-up ... telling us the extra time will be to her benefit.
      
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Another reality TV star, Spencer Pratt, is running for mayor of Los Angeles this year in an election that is definitely happening in 2026 ... and Farrah is interested to see how that shakes out, even if she apparently thought all cities elect their mayors at the same time.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Farrah's now pivoting and posting about "running for district 2026" ... so it seems her political ambitions won't be ruined by minor details like the passage of time.
      
    
          Say this for Farrah ... she's definitely keeping Austin weird!!!
      
    
          Catch the full interview on "TMZ Live."

title: Feds Say College Basketball Players Took Cash to Fix Games
description:
College Hoops Scandal
                          Feds Unveil Massive Point-Shaving Scheme
body:
College Hoops Scandal
                          Feds Unveil Massive Point-Shaving Scheme
                          ... Involving 17 Schools, 39 Players
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 15, 2026
                            8:29 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  January 15, 2026
                                9:05 AM PST
                                    
              
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Federal prosecutors say some college hoops games were straight-up rigged ... and they just dropped the hammer.
      
    
          According to a bombshell indictment unsealed Thursday, 20 men have been charged in a jaw-dropping point-shaving and bribery scheme that allegedly corrupted at least 39 Division I players, 17 schools and nearly 30 rigged matchups over the last two seasons.
      
    
          Prosecutors claim the operation was run by Shane Hennen and Marves Fairley -- two guys already deep in other federal gambling cases -- with help from former LSU and NBA player Antonio Blakeney.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The alleged plan? Pay players $10K-$30K per game to play just bad enough, so their teams wouldnâ€™t cover the betting spread ... while the bettors cashed in.
      
    
          Feds say it all started in China, where Blakeney allegedly tanked games while playing overseas, helping the group cash massive bets in the U.S.
      
    
          Prosecutors claim he pocketed about $200,000 at the end of the season for his efforts.
      
    
          Once the money started flowing, the group allegedly moved stateside -- targeting college programs mostly at smaller, mid-major schools, including DePaul, Tulane, La Salle, Fordham, Saint Louis, Buffalo, Southern Miss and more.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The same ringleaders are also facing separate federal cases tied to NBA gambling -- including one involving Terry Rozier -- and another alleged scam using ex-NBA players as bait.
      
    
          Hennen and Fairley have pleaded not guilty, but the fallout is already brutal -- the NCAA has permanently banned more than a dozen players tied to gambling and game-fixing.
      
    
          Prosecutors say legalized gambling opened the door ... and college basketball may be paying the price.

schema.headline: Feds Say College Basketball Players Took Cash to Fix Games

title: Nazis.us Website Redirects to Department of Homeland Security Page
description:
DHS Website
                          Gets Unexpected Traffic ...
                          From
body:
DHS Website
                          Gets Unexpected Traffic ...
                          From Nazi Site Redirect!!!ğŸ¤”
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 15, 2026
                            9:02 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Online users discovered Thursday morning that typing "Nazis.us" into a web browser instantly flips to the official homepage of the U.S. government's Department of Homeland Security.
      
    
          Instead of whatever youâ€™d expect to see (ğŸ™„), users are landing straight on the DHS website. Screenshots confirm the redirect, and for now, nobody seems to know why itâ€™s happening.
      
    
        
                    
                  
      
    
          There's a big question mark as to who owns the domain, whether it recently changed hands and was deliberately rerouted to the DHS ... or whether it's just a flat-out tech glitch. To be clear, anyone purchasing a web domain can redirect the URL to any other site on the internet if they so choose.
      
    
          DHS Spokesperson Tricia McLaughlin told TMZ Thursday morning ... "We've successfully blocked the redirect."
      

          With tensions boiling over nationwide -- especially amid the chaos unfolding in Minneapolis against ICE and CBP immigration raids -- the timing makes this feel like a pointed political message ... even if itâ€™s unclear which side of the divide itâ€™s actually aimed at.
      
    
          That suspicion only grows when the redirected DHS homepage prominently features language like "America Needs You" and "Become a Homeland Defender," turning an already bizarre redirect into something that feels very intentional.

schema.headline: Nazis.us Website Redirects to Department of Homeland Security Page
